event.title: the construction of Newark's first streetcar line in 1862

data.event: Residential development began with the construction of Newark's first streetcar line in 1862, and expanded greatly in the 1880s.

event.title: maintained a train station in Roseville for many years

data.event: Growth was also spurred by the Delaware, Lackawanna, & Western Railroad, which maintained a train station in Roseville for many years (closed in 1982 by New Jersey Transit).
Growth was also spurred by the Delaware, Lackawanna, & Western Railroad, which maintained a train station in Roseville for many years (closed in 1982 by New Jersey Transit).

event.title: the turn of the century, the northern section of the district was predominantly Irish-American, but the rest of the neighborhood was not associated

data.event: At the turn of the century, the northern section of the district was predominantly Irish-American, but the rest of the neighborhood was not associated with any single ethnic group.

event.title: the 1950s and 1960s, the proportion of African American residents increased

data.event: In the 1950s and 1960s, the proportion of African American residents increased.
